Detailed Description

Class for using DM calls as cell files become available.

float  hetMult,
int  maxChips,
std::vector< float > &  thresholds,
std::map< std::string, bool > &  chrXSnps,
std::string  callRateName = "" 
)

Constructor takes a vector of ProbeSets for which calls will be done as cel files become available.

Parameters:
probesets - Vector of probesets to be calculated.
hetMult - Factor to add to log likelihood to balance het/hom calls 0 for no effect.
maxChips - the maximum number of chips we expect to see
thresholds - vector of floats to threshold the calls at
chrXSnps - map of chrX snp probeset names
psVec - Vector of probesets to be calculated.
hetMult - Factor to add to log likelihood to balance het/hom calls 0 for no effect.
Returns:

Definition at line 146 of file DmListener.cpp.

void DmListener::clearForIteration (  ) 

Clear genotype results.

Gender results are retained. Call rates (total and chrX) are retained and accumulated over calls to this. The only thing this does is it drops the genotype calls. This allows us to save memory by not keeping around genotypes that are no longer needed.

Definition at line 115 of file DmListener.cpp.

References getCallRates().

void DmListener::getCallRates ( std::vector< float > &  callRates,
int  thresholdIndex 
)

Get the call rate at a particular threshold.

Note that we can keep track of the rate at multiple thresholds, but only keep the actual calls for a particular threshold due to space (RAM) concerns.

Parameters:
callRates - Vector to be filled in with call rates, one for each chip.
thresholdIndex - Which threshold to use (as defined in constructor).

bool DmListener::okForDm ( const ProbeSet *  ps  )  [static]

Will this probeset work for DM? That is does it have MM probes and matched quartets of probes on A and B allele?

- true if ok for DM, false otherwise.

void DmListener::setKeepGenotypes ( bool  s  ) 

Do we need to keep genotypes around for providing seed calls? Default yes.

If set to no, then getGenoCalls will fail if called.

Parameters:
s - true or false

Definition at line 127 of file DmListener.cpp.

void DmListener::setLayout ( ChipLayout &  layout  ) 

Set a new layout -- allows us to save some memory and only deal with SNPs in the current iteration.

Call this method before starting new interations to set the new layout. You may also want to call clearForIteration.

Parameters:
layout - the new layout of probes to run DM on
